message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE. 

The paper proposes a regularizer for reading comprehension systems, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). The paper specifically focuses on improving the ability of these systems to distinguish distractor sentences, which is a common problem in NLP. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper uses mutual information to improve the performance of the system, which is a common technique in machine learning and artificial intelligence, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) likely sub-categories as well. The paper also involves information retrieval (IR) techniques, which could place it in the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) sub-category. Finally, the paper uses a regularizer to improve the robustness of the system, which could fall under the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category.
